## File Naming Conventions

Good file naming is fundamental to research data management. Here are comprehensive resources to help you develop and maintain consistent naming practices.

### Key Principles

::: {.callout-important}
## Quick Reference: File Naming Rules

1. **Use dates:** YYYY-MM-DD format (ISO 8601)
2. **No spaces:** Use hyphens `-` or underscores `_`
3. **Be descriptive:** But keep it concise
4. **Version numbers:** v01, v02, not "final" or "final2"
5. **Avoid special characters:** No √©, √†, /, \, ?, *, etc.
6. **Lowercase:** For consistency (optional but recommended)

**Example:** `2026-02-09_interview_participant-05_v02.docx`
:::

## Backup Strategies: The 3-2-1 Rule

### Understanding 3-2-1

::: {.callout-tip}
## The 3-2-1 Backup Rule

- **3** copies of your data (original + 2 backups)
- **2** different media types (e.g., local drive + cloud)
- **1** copy off-site (cloud or physically elsewhere)
:::

### Authoritative Resources

#### 1. US-CERT (Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency)

- **Link:** <https://www.cisa.gov/sites/default/files/publications/data_backup_options.pdf>
- **Content:** Government guidelines on backup strategies

#### 2. Digital Preservation Coalition Handbook

- **Link:** <https://www.dpconline.org/handbook/technical-solutions-and-tools/backup-and-recovery>
- **Content:** Long-term preservation perspective

#### 3. Library of Congress - Personal Digital Archiving

- **Link:** <https://www.digitalpreservation.gov/personalarchiving/>
- **Content:** Practical advice for individuals

## Cloud Storage Options for Researchers

### University/Institutional Storage

Most universities provide storage solutions. Check with your institution for:

- Storage quotas
- Backup policies
- Access after graduation
- Data security and compliance

**UPPA-specific:**
- **Nuage:** <https://nuage.univ-pau.fr> (Nextcloud)
- **Huma-Num ShareDocs:** <https://documentation.huma-num.fr> (for humanities/social sciences)

### General Cloud Services

::: {.callout-warning}
## Privacy & Compliance

Before using commercial cloud services, check:
- Your institution's data policies
- Funder requirements (e.g., GDPR compliance)
- Whether data contains sensitive information
:::

**Research-friendly options:**

- **Nextcloud** (self-hosted or providers): Privacy-focused, open source
- **Box** (many universities have partnerships)
- **Google Drive** (check institutional agreement)
- **Microsoft OneDrive** (if your university uses Microsoft 365)
- **Zenodo** (for published research data): <https://zenodo.org>

## File Format Best Practices

### Choosing Preservation-Friendly Formats

Long-term accessibility depends on choosing the right file formats.

#### Key Resources

1. **[Recommended Formats Statement](https://www.loc.gov/preservation/resources/rfs/)** - Library of Congress
   - Authoritative list of preservation formats by type
   - Updated regularly

2. **[File Formats for Preservation](https://www.dcc.ac.uk/guidance/briefing-papers/standards-watch-papers/overview-file-formats-preservation)** - Digital Curation Centre
   - Explains format characteristics
   - Risk assessment for formats

3. **[Format Recommendations](https://library.stanford.edu/research/data-management-services/data-best-practices/best-practices-file-formats)** - Stanford Libraries
   - Discipline-specific recommendations

#### Quick Reference

| Data Type | Preferred Formats | Avoid |
|-----------|-------------------|-------|
| **Text** | .txt, .pdf/A, .xml, .html | .doc, .pages |
| **Tabular** | .csv, .tsv, .xml | .xlsx, .numbers |
| **Images** | .tiff, .png, .jpg | .psd, proprietary RAW |
| **Audio** | .wav, .flac | .mp3 (lossy) |
| **Video** | .mp4 (H.264), .mkv | .mov, proprietary codecs |
| **Code** | .py, .r, .txt | IDE-specific formats |

## Metadata & Documentation

File names and backups are only part of the story. Document your data!

### README Files

Every research project should have a README file explaining:
- Purpose of the project/dataset
- File naming conventions used
- Directory structure
- Data collection methods
- Variable definitions (for datasets)

**Templates:**

- [README Template](https://cornell.app.box.com/v/ReadmeTemplate) - Cornell University
- [Guide to Writing README](https://data.research.cornell.edu/content/readme) - Cornell RDM
- [README Generator](https://readme.so/) - Interactive tool
